document.title: W171-The Grape Root Borer in Tennessee

author.organization: The University of Tennessee Agricultural Extension Service

document.abstract: The grape root borer (GRB), Vitacea polistiformis (Harris), is the most damaging insect pest of grapes in Tennessee. Damage usually appears slowly; and because the pest attacks the plant below ground, symptoms are not always associated with a pest infestation. Chemical control is difficult. Here we provide information to help you identify a GRB problem and protect your grapes against damage.
